title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: My leakage still pursues its course; if I were only well, I have a notion to go north and get in (if I could) at the inn at Kirkmichael, which has always smiled upon me much.

title: The works of the Right Rev. John Sage,
author: Sage, John
snippet: 1 [Parson of Ayr. — E.]^ [Minister of Kirkmichael in Ayrshire, and afterwards Bishop ofDunblane. — E.]^ [Parson of Cumnock. — E.]* [Afterwards Bishop of Edinburgh. He was consecrated at the sametime with Sage in 1705, succeeded Bishop Rose in the Diocese of Edinburgh, and died in April 1727.— E.]^ [He was minister of the Barony parish in the city of Glasgow.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Proceeding towards the Lowlands by short marches, Mar paused at the smalltown of Kirkmichael, and afterwards at Mouline in Perthshire, moving slowly thathis friends might have leisure to assemble for his support.
